Class AdditiveFunctionTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • AdditiveFunctionTester

  • public class AdditiveFunctionTester
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of a static methods to generate prime numbers and to check if a secret function is additive. It does this by calling secret with all combinations of prime numbers up to a given value. Caching is used for optimization.
    Author:
    Ryan Gidus

      Wrapper function to call secret while caching known results.

      Use a Sieve of Eratosthenes to generate prime numbers
      static boolean isSecretAdditive(java.util.BitSet primes)
      Loops through a BitSet of prime numbers and calls secret using each combination to check if secret is additive

        public static int checkSecret(int n)
        Wrapper function to call secret while caching known results.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the result of the secret function

      • isSecretAdditive

        public static boolean isSecretAdditive(java.util.BitSet primes)
        Loops through a BitSet of prime numbers and calls secret using each combination to check if secret is additive
        Parameters:
        primes - a BitSet of prime numbers with primes marked as true
        Returns:
        a boolean representing whether or not secret is additive

      • generatePrimes

        public static java.util.BitSet generatePrimes(int N)
        Use a Sieve of Eratosthenes to generate prime numbers
        Parameters:
        N - the limit on the value of prime numbers to generate
        Returns:
        a Bitset with prime values marked as true
